definition: to catch (a disease)/to get (a bad habit)
to dye/to catch (a disease)/to acquire (bad habits etc)/to contaminate/to add color washes to a painting
on top/upon/above/upper/previous/first (of multiple parts)/to climb/to get onto/to go up/to attend (class or university)
see 上聲|上声[shang3 sheng1]

sentences.english: He was addicted to all sorts of vice.
Once a person has contracted Chagas disease, the infection may remain dormant for decades.
sentences.chinese: 一個人一旦染上恰加斯病，這種感染可能潛伏數十年。

sentences.english: However, He catches obvious dogmatism and often neglects the creative experience.
sentences.chinese: 一個染上明顯的教條主義，常常“忘記”創作經驗。

sentences.english: With this, two spots flushed under her ears. She felt something unspeakable in her heart.
sentences.chinese: 雙耳下也染上兩點紅暈，心裏有一種說不出的意味。

sentences.english: Tinges the landscape with a golden hue.
sentences.chinese: 它們給這片風景染上一片金色。

sentences.english: The rabid dog foamed at the mouth.
sentences.chinese: 那隻狗染上狂犬病，口吐白沫。

sentences.english: Think of it as a piece of string dyed in four different colors.
sentences.chinese: 我們可以把它當作一段染上了四種不同顏色的細繩。

sentences.english: The tremendous spaciousness of it was glowing with rich gold .
sentences.chinese: 蒼茫遼闊的景色染上了一片瑰麗濃豔的金黃色。

sentences.english: He has picked up some bad habits at that club.
sentences.chinese: 他在那個俱樂部沾染上了一些壞習氣。

sentences.english: With hours of smudge-proof, just-picked perfection, you'll be the prettiest bloom in the bunch!
sentences.chinese: 染上這令人愉悅的深粉色，你就是最美的花樣女孩兒。

sentences.english: But I'll take TMI over black lungs any day.
sentences.chinese: 但是，我寧願發短信發到手軟，也不願染上黑肺病。

sentences.english: But she developed a sexually transmitted infection that caused a raging fever.
sentences.chinese: 不過，後來她染上了一種性傳染病，引起高燒。

sentences.english: The sky has assumed a rosy wash in the east where a house is burning.
sentences.chinese: 東邊有一所房子在燃燒，天空裏染上了一抹玫瑰紅。

sentences.english: The state or quality of being immaterial.
sentences.chinese: 沾染上有毒物質的狀態。

sentences.english: These are habits which soon fasten themselves on people.
sentences.chinese: 這些習慣都是人們極易沾染上的。

sentences.english: Now the maple leaves are tinged with autumn red.
sentences.chinese: 現在楓葉淡淡地染上了秋天的紅色。

definition: to pollute (often fig.)/to be infected by/to gain a small advantage
to be contaminated/to be gradually influenced
to moisten/to be infected by/to receive benefit or advantage through a contact/to touch
to appear/to emerge/to surface
to infect/contagious
to fall ill/to contract a disease
drug addiction
to darken
sexually transmitted disease/venereal disease
muddy/covered in (mud, dust, sweat, blood etc)/daubed in
variant of 彌漫|弥漫[mi2 man4]
infection/to infect/to influence
dark/dim (light)/dull (color)/drab/(fig.) gloomy/bleak
to be covered with/to be filled with
to suffer (from illness)/to contract (a disease)/misfortune/trouble/danger/worry
colored/ash-colored
